intro: Brotobroma asperum, commonly known as the rough brotobroma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
